thread.title: Strong pitching earns Royals Game One win over Blue Jays
thread.title_full: Strong pitching earns Royals Game One win over Blue Jays | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: Strong pitching earns Royals Game One win over Blue Jays
text:
Strong pitching propelled the Kansas City Royals to a 5-0 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays in Game One of the American League Championship Series on Friday.
Catcher Salvador Perez slugged a solo home run and four Royals' pitchers kept the Toronto bats in check at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri to draw first blood in the best-of-seven series.
Kansas City starter Edinson Volquez pitched six strong innings, striking out five and giving up two hits and four walks before handing over to the team's bullpen to close it out.
The Royals are seeking to return to the World Series after losing to the San Francisco Giants in seven games last season.
Game Two is in Kansas City on Saturday.
(Reporting by Andrew Both in Cary, North Carolina; Editing by Peter Rutherford )
